meanings.definition: A person or group that resists joining or participating in something.
meanings.sent1: The holdout in our class always sits alone during group activities.
meanings.sent2: The holdout refused to join the team despite multiple invitations.
meanings.sent3: The holdout at the party just wanted to enjoy the music by themselves.
meanings.sent4: She was the holdout in the family, always opting out of group vacations.
meanings.sent5: The holdout's absence made the team feel incomplete.

meanings.definition: An act of resisting or refusing to comply with something.
meanings.sent1: Her holdout against the new rule caused quite a stir in the office.
meanings.sent2: The holdout of the workers led to a delay in the project completion.
meanings.sent3: His holdout on eating vegetables made his mom resort to creative cooking.
meanings.sent4: The holdout on signing the contract raised suspicions among the investors.
meanings.sent5: The holdout's stubbornness only made the situation more challenging.

meanings.definition: A piece of property or land that is not sold or developed along with the rest of a larger area.
meanings.sent1: The small house at the corner was the holdout in the neighborhood's development plans.
meanings.sent2: The holdout of the landowner prevented the construction of the new shopping mall.
meanings.sent3: The holdout of the old barn added a rustic charm to the modern housing complex.
meanings.sent4: The holdout of the empty lot puzzled the real estate developers.
meanings.sent5: The holdout property stood out like a forgotten treasure amidst the bustling city.
